desc: 19415 Deerfield Avenue, Suite 213, Lansdowne, Virginia 20176

doctors.name: Linda Leatherbury, MD
doctors.title: Board-certified Pediatric Cardiologist
desc: Has over 30 years of experience at Children’s National
Serves as Assistant Professor of Pediatrics at George Washington University

name: Virginia Hospital Center Cardiology Clinic
desc: 1701 North George Mason Drive, Arlington, VA 22205

doctors.name: Ashraf Harahsheh, MD
doctors.title: Board-certified Pediatric Cardiologist
desc: Plays a major role in teaching cardiology fellows
Special interest in the preventive cardiology program with a focus on lipids, murmurs, Kawasaki disease, syncope, and chest pain

doctors.name: Thomas J. Hougen, MD
doctors.title: Board-certified Pediatric Cardiologist
desc: More than 35 years experience in pediatric cardiology
Provides full service pediatric cardiology consultations and newborn nursery consultations

doctors.name: David Schidlow, MD
doctors.title: Board-certified Pediatric Cardiologist
desc: Expert in fetal echocardiography and other non-invasive cardiac imaging such as trans-thoracic and transesophageal echocardiography, and cardiac MRI
Works with families in the Fetal Heart Program, guiding them through prenatal diagnosis, delivery, and post-natal care of children with congenital heart disease

name: Northern Virginia Outpatient Center
desc: 3023 Hamaker Court, Fairfax, Virginia 22031

doctors.name: Charles Berul, MD
doctors.title: Division Chief, Cardiology
desc: Published over 150 peer-reviewed, pediatric cardiology publications
Internationally recognized expert in pediatric cardiac electrophysiology

doctors.name: Mary T. Donofrio, MD
doctors.title: Director, Fetal Heart and Critical Care Delivery Programs
desc: Established the region’s only Early Fetal Cardiac Imaging Program
Specializes in pediatric echocardiography, complex congenital heart disease management, and transitional care

doctors.name: Lowell Frank, MD
doctors.title: Board-certified Pediatric Cardiologist
desc: Has a special interest in advanced echocardiographic measures of ventricular function, and complex congenital heart disease
Participates in transthoracic, transesophageal, and three-dimensional echocardiography

doctors.name: Jeffrey Moak, MD
doctors.title: Director, Electrophysiology and Pacing Program
desc: Director at Children’s for 20+ years
Treats patients with cardiac arrhythmias and autonomic nervous system dysfunction
Pioneer in the laser extraction technique
Developed the Clinic for Autonomic Disorders Evaluation (CADE) at Children’s National
Spearheads a new initiative assessing the safest practice for treatment of children with cardiac arrhythmias in the Cardiac ICU

doctors.name: Jessica Colyer, MD
doctors.title: Medical Unit Director, Heart, Lung, and Kidney Unit
desc: Sees patients with congenital heart disease and heart murmurs, including new patients and newborns
Special interest in outreach and education to parents and families about heart health

doctors.title: Board-certified Pediatric Cardiologist
desc: Has over 30 years of experience at Children’s National
Serves as Assistant Professor of Pediatrics at George Washington University

doctors.name: Roger Ruckman, MD

desc: Has over 35 years of experience at Children’s National
